PF2E.ActionBrowserSearchHint:
Puedes buscar por nombre o características personalizadas. Los posibles atributos a buscar son:
tipo de conjuro, nivel, escuela, componentes, materiales, objetivo, rango, tiempo, duración, daño, tipo de daño, salvación, concentración, ritual, característica y clases.
Ejemplo: 'fuego, daño:d6' para mostrar todos los conjuros que tienen fuego en su nombre y un d6 en el daño.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You move up to your Speed.
Notes.success: Success You move up to your Speed, treating it as difficult terrain (every 5 feet costs 10 feet of movement).
Notes.failure: Failure You must remain stationary to keep your balance (wasting the action) or you fall. If you fall, your turn ends.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You fall and your turn ends.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target is distracted and takes a -3 status penalty to Perception and Will saves for 1 minute. The target can end the effect early with a retort to your Bon Mot. This can either be a single action that has the concentrate trait or an appropriate skill action to frame their retort. The GM determines which skill actions qualify, though they must take at least 1 action. Typically, the retort needs to use a linguistic Charisma-based skill action. @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.CtrZFI3RV0yPNzTv]{Effect: Bon Mot (Critical Success)}
Notes.success: Success The target is distracted and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception and Will saves for 1 minute. The target can end the effect early with a retort to your Bon Mot. This can either be a single action that has the concentrate trait or an appropriate skill action to frame their retort. The GM determines which skill actions qualify, though they must take at least 1 action. Typically, the retort needs to use a linguistic Charisma-based skill action. @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.GoSls6SKCFmSoDxT]{Effect: Bon Mot}
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Your quip is atrocious. You take the same penalty an enemy would take had you succeeded. This ends after 1 minute or if you issue another Bon Mot and succeed. @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.GoSls6SKCFmSoDxT]{Effect: Bon Mot}

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You move up, across, or safely down the incline for 5 feet plus 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 10 feet for most PCs).
Notes.success: Success You move up, across, or safely down the incline for 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 5 feet for most PCs, minimum 5 feet if your Speed is below 20 feet).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You fall. If you began the climb on stable ground, you fall and land @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target gives you the information you seek or agrees to follow your directives so long as they aren't likely to harm the target in any way. The target continues to comply for an amount of time determined by the GM but not exceeding 1 day, at which point the target becomes unfriendly (if they weren't already unfriendly or hostile). However, the target is too scared of you to retaliate—at least in the short term.
Notes.success: Success As critical success, but once the target becomes unfriendly, they might decide to act against you—for example, by reporting you to the authorities or assisting your enemies.
Notes.failure: Failure The target doesn't do what you say, and if they were not already unfriendly or hostile, they become unfriendly.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The target refuses to comply, becomes hostile if they weren't already, and can't be Coerced by you for at least 1 week.

Error.ItemReferenceMismatch: Only accepts physical items for Craft from a compendium or the world's Item Directory.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Crafting reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level + 1 and your proficiency rank in Crafting.
Notes.success: Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Crafting reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level and your proficiency rank.
Notes.failure: Failure You fail to complete the item. You can salvage the raw materials you supplied for their full value. If you want to try again, you must start over.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You fail to complete the item. You ruin 10% of the raw materials you supplied, but you can salvage the rest. If you want to try again, you must start over.

Warning.NotPhysicalItem: Specified item {item} is not a physical item.
Warning.MissingItem: Unable to Craft unknown item with ID {uuid}.

Notes.success: Success You become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to each creature whose Perception DC is less than or equal to your result. (The hidden condition allows you to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} away.) This lasts until the end of your turn or until you do anything except Step or use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} action of the Stealth skill. If you Strike a creature, the creature remains @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against that attack, and you then become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed}. If you do anything else, you become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} just before you act unless the GM determines otherwise.
Notes.failure: Failure You don't divert the attention of any creatures whose Perception DC exceeds your result, and those creatures are aware you were trying to trick them.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico El objetivo queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{asustado 2}.
Notes.success: Éxito El objetivo queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{asustado 1}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You knock the item out of the opponent's grasp. It falls to the ground in the opponent's space.
Notes.success: Success You weaken your opponent's grasp on the item. Until the start of that creature's turn, attempts to Disarm the opponent of that item gain a +2 circumstance bonus, and the target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to attacks with the item or other checks requiring a firm grasp on the item. @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.z3ATL8DcRVrT0Uzt]{Effect: Disarm (Success)}
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You lose your balance and become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn.

EncouragingWords.Title: Encouraging Words
EncouragingWords.ContentMain: Select a target DC. Remember that you can't attempt a heal above your proficiency. Attempting to do so will downgrade the DC and amount healed to the highest you're capable of.
EncouragingWords.BadArgs: This action must be performed with exactly one character or NPC.
EncouragingWords.NotTrained: {name} is not trained in Diplomacy and doesn't know how to use Encouraging Words.
EncouragingWords.StaminaNotEnabled: The Stamina variant is not enabled.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Desarbolas por completo las defensas del oponente contra ti. El objetivo queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{desprevenido} contra los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo que intentas contra él hasta el final de tu siguiente turno.
Notes.success: Éxito Tu enemigo resulta engañado, pero sólo momentáneamente. El objetivo queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{desprevenido} ante el siguiente ataque cuerpo a cuerpo que intentas contra él antes del final de tu turno actual.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Tu finta acaba fatal. Quedas @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{desprevenido} contra los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo que intenta el objetivo contra ti hasta el final de tu siguiente turno.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You open the door, window, container, or gate and can avoid damaging it in the process.
Notes.success: Success You break the door, window, container, or gate open, and the door, window, container, or gate gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} condition. If it's especially sturdy, the GM might have it take damage but not be broken.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Your attempt jams the door, window, container, or gate shut, imposing a -2 circumstance penalty on future attempts to Force it Open.

Notes.success: Success You collect information about the individual or topic. The GM determines the specifics.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You collect incorrect information about the individual or topic.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Tu oponente queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{neutralizado} hasta el final de tu siguiente turno si tú no te mueves o tu oponente @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{huye}.
Notes.success: Éxito Tu oponente queda @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrado} agarrado hasta el final de tu siguiente turno si tú no te mueves o tu oponente @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{huye}.
Notes.failure: Fallo Fallas en agarrar a tu oponente. Si tenías a tu oponente @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrado} o @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{neutralizado} utilizando una Presa, dichos estados sobre la criatura se acaban.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Si tenías a tu oponente @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{agarrado} o @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{neutralizado}, se suelta. El objetivo puede, o bien agarrarte (como si hubiera tenido éxito en una acción de @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{presa} contra ti), o bien obligarte a caer @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{derribado}.

Notes.success: Success If the creature could see you, you're now @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it instead of observed. If you were @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature, you retain that condition.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Increase the maximum vertical distance to 8 feet, or increase the maximum vertical distance to 5 feet and maximum horizontal distance to 10 feet.
Notes.success: Success Increase the maximum vertical distance to 5 feet.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You don't @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} at all, and instead you fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in your space.

Notes.success: Success You trick the creature into thinking you're the person you're disguised as. You might have to attempt a new check if your behavior changes.
Notes.failure: Failure The creature can tell you're not who you claim to be.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The creature can tell you're not who you claim to be, and it recognizes you if it would know you without a disguise.

Notes.success: Success The target believes your lie.
Notes.failure: Failure The target doesn't believe your lie and gains a +4 circumstance bonus against your attempts to Lie for the duration of your conversation. The target is also more likely to be suspicious of you in the future.

Notes.success: Success Increase the maximum horizontal distance you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} to the desired distance.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} normally, but then fall and land @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target's attitude toward you improves by two steps.
Notes.success: Success The target's attitude toward you improves by one step.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The target's attitude toward you decreases by one step.

Notes.success: Success You succeed at the maneuver.
Notes.failure: Failure Your maneuver fails. The GM chooses if you simply can't move or if some other detrimental effect happens. The outcome should be appropriate for the maneuver you attempted (for instance, being blown off course if you were trying to fly against a strong wind).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure As failure, but the consequence is more dire.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Fuerzas la cerradura, o acumulas dos éxitos en pro de forzar una cerradura compleja. No dejas rastro de tus manipulaciones.
Notes.success: Éxito Fuerzas la cerradura o acumulas un éxito en pro de forzar una cerradura compleja.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Rompes una herramienta. Arreglarla requiere el uso de Artesanía para @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{repararla} o utilizar un juego de ganzúas de recambio (que cuestan 2 pp, o 3 po unas herramientas de ladrón infiltrador).

RaiseAShield.BadArgs: Esta acción debe realizarse únicamente con un personaje o PNJ.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success The target agrees to your request without qualifications.
Notes.success: Success The target agrees to your request, but they might demand added provisions or alterations to the request.
Notes.failure: Failure The target refuses the request, though they might propose an alternative that is less extreme.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure Not only does the target refuse the request, but their attitude toward you decreases by one step due to the temerity of the request.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success If you were searching for creatures, any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature you critically succeeded against becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} by you. If you were searching for an object, you learn its location.
Notes.success: Success If you were searching for creatures, any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creature you succeeded against becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from you instead of @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, and any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature you succeeded against becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} by you. If you were searching for an object, you learn its location or get a clue to its whereabouts, as determined by the GM.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You determine the creature's true intentions and get a solid idea of any mental magic affecting it.
Notes.success: Success You can tell whether the creature is behaving normally, but you don't know its exact intentions or what magic might be affecting it.
Notes.failure: Failure You detect what a deceptive creature wants you to believe. If they're not being deceptive, you believe they're behaving normally.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You get a false sense of the creature's intentions.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico Empujas a tu oponente hasta 10 pies (3 m), separándolo de ti. Después, puedes dar una Zancada pero tienes que moverte la misma distancia y en la misma dirección.
Notes.success: Éxito Empujas hacia atrás a tu oponente 5 pies (1,5 m). Después, puedes dar una Zancada pero tienes que moverte la misma distancia y en la misma dirección.
Notes.criticalFailure: Éxito crítico Pierdes el equilibrio, caes y quedas @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{derribado}.

Notes.success: Success You're undetected by the creature during your movement and remain undetected by the creature at the end of it.
Notes.failure: Failure A telltale sound or other sign gives your position away, though you still remain unseen. You're hidden from the creature throughout your movement and remain so
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You're spotted! You're observed by the creature throughout your movement and remain so. If you're invisible and were hidden from the creature, instead of being observed you're hidden throughout your movement and remain so.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You squeeze through the tight space in 1 minute per 10 feet of squeezing.
Notes.success: Success You squeeze through in 1 minute per 5 feet.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You become stuck in the tight space. While you're stuck, you can spend 1 minute attempting another Acrobatics check at the same DC. Any result on that check other than a critical failure causes you to become unstuck.

SteelYourResolve.Title: Steel Your Resolve
SteelYourResolve.Content: Spend a resolve point and regain stamina?
SteelYourResolve.BadArgs: This action must be performed with exactly one character or NPC.
SteelYourResolve.StaminaNotEnabled: The Stamina variant is not enabled.
SteelYourResolve.NoStamina: {name} is tired and needs to go to bed! No resolve points remaining.
SteelYourResolve.RecoverStamina: {name} has {ratio} SP and spends a resolve point, recovering half their maximum Stamina.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You move through the water 10 feet, plus 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 15 feet for most PCs).
Notes.success: Success You move through the water 5 feet, plus 5 feet per 20 feet of your land Speed (a total of 10 feet for most PCs).
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You make no progress, and if you're holding your breath, you lose 1 round of air.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Éxito crítico El objetivo cae @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{derribado} y sufre [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning] # Bludgeoning damage]]{1d6} de daño contundente.
Notes.success: Éxito El objetivo cae @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{derribado}.
Notes.criticalFailure: Fallo crítico Pierdes el equilibrio y caes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{derribado}.

Notes.success: Success You move through the enemy's space, treating the squares in its space as difficult terrain (every 5 feet costs 10 feet of movement). If you don't have enough Speed to move all the way through its space, you get the same effect as a failure.
Notes.failure: Failure Your movement ends, and you trigger reactions as if you had moved out of the square you started in.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You throw the creature the desired distance and it lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}.
Notes.success: Success You throw the creature the desired distance.
Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You don't throw the creature, and it's no longer @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Restrained]{Restrained} by you.

ClericSpells.Hint: To add a spell, drag and drop one onto this sheet.

DivineAbility.Label: Divine Ability
DivineAbility.Hint: If choosing the Raised by Belief background, its ability boost options come from a deity.

FavoredWeapons.Label: Favored Weapon(s)
FavoredWeapons.Hint: Almost all deities have a single favored weapon, but a few have both a favored weapon and unarmed attack.

Alternate.Label: Alternate Domains
Alternate.Hint: A cleric can take the Expanded Domain Initiate feat to gain access to one of their deity's alternate domains.

Abomination.Label: Abomination
Abomination.Description: You seek to instill abhorrence and horror in those around you.

Air.Label: Air
Air.Description: You can control winds and the weather.

Ambition.Label: Ambition
Ambition.Description: You strive to keep up with and outpace the competition.

Change.Label: Change
Change.Description: You can restructure the physical and metaphysical.

Cities.Label: Cities
Cities.Description: You have powers over urban environments and denizens.

Cold.Label: Cold
Cold.Description: You control ice, snow, and freezing temperatures.

Confidence.Label: Confidence
Confidence.Description: You overcome your fear and project pride.

Creation.Label: Creation
Creation.Description: You have divine abilities related to crafting and art.

Darkness.Label: Darkness
Darkness.Description: You operate in the darkness and take away the light.

Death.Label: Death
Death.Description: You have the power to end lives and destroy undead.

Decay.Label: Decay
Decay.Description: You have the power to spoil and deteriorate matter.

Delirium.Label: Delirium
Delirium.Description: You can bring about hallucinations and restlessness.

Destruction.Label: Destruction
Destruction.Description: You are a conduit for divine devastation.

Dreams.Label: Dreams
Dreams.Description: You have the power to enter and manipulate dreams.

Dust.Label: Dust
Dust.Description: You have the power to dry and crumble what opposes you.

Duty.Label: Duty
Duty.Description: You defend oaths and carry out your divine missions with great dedication.

Family.Label: Family
Family.Description: You aid and protect your family and community more effectively.

Fate.Label: Fate
Fate.Description: You see and understand hidden inevitabilities.

Freedom.Label: Freedom
Freedom.Description: You liberate yourself and others from shackles and constraints.

Glyph.Label: Glyph
Glyph.Description: You wield power over written words and symbols.

Healing.Label: Healing
Healing.Description: Your healing magic is particularly potent.

Indulgence.Label: Indulgence
Indulgence.Description: You feast mightily and can shake off the effects of overindulging.

Lightning.Label: Lightning
Lightning.Description: You control electricity, thunder, and storms.

Luck.Label: Luck
Luck.Description: You’re unnaturally lucky and keep out of harm’s way.

Magic.Label: Magic
Magic.Description: You perform the unexpected and inexplicable.

Might.Label: Might
Might.Description: Your physical power is bolstered by divine strength.

Moon.Label: Moon
Moon.Description: You command powers associated with the moon.

Naga.Label: Naga
Naga.Description: Like the serpentine nagas, you're in tune with cosmic forces that Ravithra once controlled.

Nature.Label: Nature
Nature.Description: You hold power over animals and plants.

Nightmares.Label: Nightmares
Nightmares.Description: You fill minds with horror and dread.

Pain.Label: Pain
Pain.Description: You punish those who displease you with the sharp sting of pain.

Passion.Label: Passion
Passion.Description: You evoke passion, whether as love or lust.

Perfection.Label: Perfection
Perfection.Description: You strive to perfect your mind, body, and spirit.

Plague.Label: Plague
Plague.Description: You wield disease and pestilence like a weapon.

Secrecy.Label: Secrecy
Secrecy.Description: You protect secrets and keep them hidden.

Sorrow.Label: Sorrow
Sorrow.Description: You have a painful connection to melancholy and sadness.

Soul.Label: Soul
Soul.Description: You wield power over the spiritual.

Star.Label: Star
Star.Description: You command the power of the stars.

Sun.Label: Sun
Sun.Description: You harness the power of the sun and other light sources, and punish undead.

Swarm.Label: Swarm
Swarm.Description: You exert control over masses of creatures.

Time.Label: Time
Time.Description: You reign over the flow of time.

Toil.Label: Toil
Toil.Description: You work constantly and refuse to let anything stand in your way.

Travel.Label: Travel
Travel.Description: You have power over movement and journeys.

Trickery.Label: Trickery
Trickery.Description: You deceive others and cause mischief.

Truth.Label: Truth
Truth.Description: You pierce lies and discover the truth.

Tyranny.Label: Tyranny
Tyranny.Description: You wield power to rule and enslave others.

Undeath.Label: Undeath
Undeath.Description: Your magic carries close ties to the undead.

Vigil.Label: Vigil
Vigil.Description: You watch over those long passed and guard their secrets.

Water.Label: Water
Water.Description: You control water and bodies of water.

Wealth.Label: Wealth
Wealth.Description: You hold power over wealth, trade, and treasure.

Wyrmkin.Label: Wyrmkin
Wyrmkin.Description: You draw on the power of dragons, linnorms, and other powerful reptilian creatures.

Zeal.Label: Zeal
Zeal.Description: Your inner fire increases your combat prowess.

GeneratedName.Hint: This is the name of the base weapon. For most weapons, the base is used to generate a fuller name, taking into account the material composition and/or runes. Giving this weapon a custom name or marking it as "specific" will prevent the generated name from appearing.

Weapon.MandatoryMelee: This weapon has a trait that can only be used with melee weapons.

MaterialAndRunes.Title: Material Composition and Runes
MaterialAndRunes.Hint: Precious material and runes allow for in-depth customization of a weapon. Besides improving its ability to harm enemies, they also affect the weapon's level, rarity, price, and name. To suppress a weapon's renaming, give it any custom name or mark it as a specific magic weapon.

MeleeUsage.Label: Melee Usage
MeleeUsage.Hint: A combination weapon has a firearm form or usage and a melee weapon form or usage. Switching between the melee weapon usage and the firearm usage requires an Interact action. However, if your last action was a successful melee Strike against a foe using a combination weapon, you can make a firearm Strike with the combination weapon against that foe without fully switching to the firearm usage, firing the firearm just as you hit with the melee attack. In this case, the combination weapon returns to its melee usage after the firearm Strike.

OtherTags.Label: Other Tags
OtherTags.Hint: These are tags indicating classifications in 2nd Edition rules that lack explicit status/definition but are still yet heavily relied upon. Some may be automatically added when other properties are present.

SpecificMagicWeapon.Label: Specific Magic Weapon
SpecificMagicWeapon.Hint: Marking this weapon as a specific magic weapon indicates that it does more than what its material composition and runes allow. The name, level, rarity, and price will no longer be overridden from a precious material or runes at the time of marking. Those material and runes will, however, serve as a baseline for level, rarity, and price adjustments from later upgrades.

PF2E.PreciousMaterialAbysiumDescription: A blue-green metal with an eerie green luminescence, abysium radiates power that's inimical to life. Careless exposure to the material can lead to long‑term damage to the immune system; as such, mining abysium is hazardous, as large quantities of the metal in an area cause all nearby creatures to become sick. A creature carrying an abysium object is sickened 1 for a standard‑grade object of light Bulk, sickened 2 for a standard‑grade object of 1 Bulk or more or a high-grade object of light Bulk, or sickened 3 for a high‑grade object of 1 Bulk or more. This and all other sickening effects of abysium are poison effects. Crafters can use 1 abysium chunk to create up to 6 doses of poisonous abysium powder. Unscrupulous smiths have harnessed abysium's toxic properties to create noxious weapons and deadly substances. All objects crafted from abysium shed dim light in a 10‑foot radius.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialAdamantineDescription: Mined from rocks that fell from the heavens, adamantine is one of the hardest metals known. It has a shiny, black appearance, and it is prized for its amazing resiliency and ability to hold an incredibly sharp edge.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialColdIronDescription: Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike. Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDarkwoodDescription: Darkwood is a very lightweight wood found primarily in old- growth forests in south-central Avistan; it is dark as ebony but has a slight purple tint. A darkwood item's Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of darkwood is based on the item's normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of darkwood, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDjezetDescription: This rust red metal is liquid at room temperature, making it challenging for all but the most skilled metallurgists to craft with and earning it the name "quickiron" in some places. Djezet is also extremely reactive to magic, even in its solid, workable alloyed form. It glows when targeted by magic, and objects crafted with djezet alloys glow with scarlet striations, which lead some smiths to nickname it "tiger iron." When targeted by spells, objects crafted from djezet alloys exhibit these glowing red markings that last for 1 round or the duration of the spell, whichever is longer. A djezet mass contains enough djezet to refine into up to two djezet doses.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialDragonhideDescription: The hide and scales of a dragon can be used to Craft any item normally made of ordinary leather or hide. Dragonhide varies in color from blue to glittering gold, depending on the dragon it came from. Due to the scales' resiliency, it can also be used to Craft armor usually made out of metal plates (such as a breastplate, half plate, and full plate), allowing such armor to be made without metal. Dragonhide objects are immune to one damage type, depending on the type of dragon.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialGrisantianPeltDescriptio: This supernaturally tough animal skin is gold and shines in sunlight. It can be used to make any item usually made of cloth, leather, or hide. This material is immune to fire, and its Hardness is doubled against piercing or slashing damage. Up to 4 Bulk of grisantian pelt can be harvested from a single creature (this is usually more than enough for 4 suits of standard grade armor or 2 suit of high-grade armor).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialInubrixDescription: This pale, malleable metal's unusual molecular structure allows it to partially pass through iron and steel without touching them. While this property is useful for making weapons that bypass metal armor, inubrix is barely sturdier than lead. Even in an alloyed state, this skymetal is so fragile that it's difficult to use in crafting reliable shields and less than ideal for crafting armor.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialMithralDescription: Mithral is renowned for its lightness, durability, and effectiveness against a range of creatures including devils and lycanthropes. It has the same sheen as silver but a slightly lighter hue. Mithral weapons and armor are treated as if they were silver for the purpose of damaging creatures with weakness to silver. A metal item made of mithral is lighter than one made of iron or steel: the item's Bulk is reduced by 1 (reduced to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of this material is based on the item's normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of mithral, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialNoqualDescription: Light and strong, noqual also demonstrates a powerful resistance to magic. A side effect of this resistance is that making magical weapons out of noqual requires complex and expensive alchemical treatments. Kevoth‑Kul, the Black Sovereign of Numeria, has developed an alloy of noqual and cold iron known as sovereign steel to help mitigate this property. The metal's crystalline appearance might suggest that it's fragile, but the pale‑green material can be worked similarly to iron. Objects made of noqual have a +4 circumstance bonus on saves against magic that the item attempts and grant their bonus to saves the owner makes specifically to protect the item from magic (such as against the rusting grasp spell).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialOrichalcumDescription: The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn't as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum's time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn't destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSiccatiteDescription: In its raw state, this silvery ore is either scalding hot or freezing cold. Metallurgists disagree over whether siccatite is two related substances or one substance that determines its temperature output via some unknown process. Whatever the reason, the extreme temperature of the material means it must be handled carefully. Hot siccatite can easily ignite flammables such as paper and dry brush, and cold siccatite left in moist areas quickly surrounds itself with a thick layer of ice. A creature that comes into physical contact with a significant amount of siccatite takes 1 energy Damage for each round of continued contact (either fire or cold damage, for hot and cold siccatite respectively).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSilverDescription: Las armas de plata son un azote para las criaturas que van desde los diablos hasta los hombres lobo. Los objetos de plata son menos duraderos que los de acero, y los de baja calidad suelen ser simplemente chapados en plata.
PF2E.PreciousMaterialSovereignSteelDescriptio: Created by Black Sovereign Kevoth-Kul, this unique alloy of cold iron and the skymetal noqual can provide protection from magical assault. The process of cold-forging the two materials together is quite complicated and precise. Characters in search of sovereign steel weapons and armor will almost assuredly have to travel to Starfall to procure gear made from this rare alloy. While some believe it possible to craft shields of sovereign steel as well, in one of his fits, Kevoth-Kul yelled that he had no use for them and banned anyone from making such a thing. So far, his smiths have been too afraid to confirm whether or not it was a joke. All sovereign steel items (including weapon and armor below) have a +4 circumstance bonus on saves against magic that the item makes, and grant their bonus to saves the owner makes specifically to protect the item from magic (such as against the rusting grasp spell).
PF2E.PreciousMaterialWarpglassDescription: This bizarre substance is fashioned from the raw, chaotic quintessence of the Maelstrom. It can be fashioned into weapons and items, but is too unstable to make into useful armor or shields. Raw warpglass is an opalescent glassy material with surprising strength. When worked, it changes its appearance-though not its properties-to appear as random striations of other metals and types of stone.

Homebrew.Name: Homebrew Elements
Homebrew.Label: Manage Homebrew Elements
Homebrew.Hint: Add custom traits, languages, and other elements of a homebrew world.
Homebrew.Instructions: These settings allow GMs to add traits, languages, and other elements to a homebrew world. To add such elements, simply type the desired terms in the appropriate fields, separated by commas or tab keystrokes. They will then appear in the appropriate places on actor and item sheets. To update a term, click it to make the desired changes.

CreatureTraits.Name: Creature Traits
CreatureTraits.Hint: Traits that can be applied to any creature and some item types (e.g., Dragon, Gnome)

FeatTraits.Name: Feat Traits
FeatTraits.Hint: Traits that can be applied to feats (e.g., Lineage, Monk) and actions

Languages.Name: Languages
Languages.Hint: Languages for characters to know or learn (e.g., Draconic, Gnomish)

MagicSchools.Name: Magic Schools

SpellTraits.Name: Spell Traits
SpellTraits.Hint: Traits that can be applied to any spell (e.g., Cursebound, Healing)

WeaponTraits.Name: Weapon Traits

PartyVision.Name: Shared party vision
PartyVision.Hint: If enabled, all players will mutually share token vision, regardless of permissions or token selection.

SecretDamage.Name: Hide damage taken message
SecretDamage.Hint: If enabled, only the GM will see the damage/healing taken messages that are generated by the damage chat cards for tokens not owned by a player.

SecretCondition.Name: Hide condition update message
SecretCondition.Hint: If enabled, only the GM will see the condition update and reminder messages that are generated for tokens not owned by a player.

ShowDC.Name: Show DCs on attacks and saves
ShowDC.Hint: Decide who can see the DC of a check.

ShowResults.Name: Show results on attacks and saves
ShowResults.Hint: Decide who can see the result of a check rolled from a chat card.

Autoscale.Name: Scale tokens according to size
Autoscale.Hint: If enabled, tokens will be scaled to 1.0 or (if belonging to a small creature) 0.8

ShowClockButton.Hint: Set whether to show the clock button at all (requires refresh).

PlayersCanView.Name: Player Access
PlayersCanView.Hint: Set whether players can view the World Clock.

SyncDarknessScene.Name: Synchronize Darkness (Current Scene)

PF2E.SpellCollectionRemove: Eliminar de la colección de conjuros

Default.Description: Atacas con un arma que empuñas o con un ataque sin armas, designando como objetivo a una criatura a tu alcance (para un ataque cuerpo a cuerpo) o que está en un incremento de rango de distancia (para un ataque a distancia). Haz la tirada de ataque para el arma o el ataque sin armas que estás utilizando, y compara el resultado con la CA de la criatura objetivo para determinar el efecto.
Default.CriticalSuccess: Como éxito, pero infliges doble daño.
Default.Success: Infliges daño según el arma o ataque sin armas, incluyendo cualquier modificador, bonificador y penalizador que tienes al daño.

Unarmed.Description: Atacas con un ataque sin armas, designando como objetivo a una criatura a tu alcance. Haz la tirada de ataque sin armas que estás utilizando, y compara el resultado con la CA de la criatura objetivo para determinar el efecto.
Unarmed.Success: Infliges daño según ataque sin armas, incluyendo cualquier modificador, bonificador y penalizador que tienes al daño.

Melee.Description: Atacas con un arma que empuñas, designandocomo objetivo a una criatura a tu alcance. Haz la tirada de ataque para el arma que estás utilizando, y compara el resultado con la CA de la criatura objetivo para determinar el efecto.
Melee.Success: Infliges daño según el arma, incluyendo cualquier modificador, bonificador y penalizador que tienes al daño.

Ranged.Description: Atacas con un arma que empuñas que está en un incremento de rango de distancia. Haz la tirada de ataque para el arma que estás utilizando, y compara el resultado con la CA de la criatura objetivo para determinar el efecto.
Ranged.Success: Infliges daño según el arma, incluyendo cualquier modificador, bonificador y penalizador que tienes al daño.
Ranged.NoAmmo: No hay ninguna munición asignada a {weapon}. Comprueba la pestaña de acciones de la pestaña de {actor} de la hoja.

Combined.Description: Atacas con un arma que empuñas, designandocomo objetivo a una criatura a tu alcance (para un ataque cuerpo acuerpo) o que está en un incremento de rango de distancia (para unataque a distancia). Haz la tirada de ataque para el arma o el ataque sin armas que estás utilizando, y compara el resultado con la CA de la criatura objetivo para determinar el efecto.
Combined.Success: Infliges daño según el arma, incluyendo cualquier modificador, bonificador y penalizador que tienes al daño.

PF2E.TempHPTitle: La cantidad de puntos de golpe temporales que tienes
PF2E.TemporaryItemToolTip: This item is temporary and will expire after a duration or during daily preparations. It has no value and cannot be sold.
